page.title: 12MIDDLEWOOD WAY, ADLINGTON.
page.content: David Bellamy opened the Middlewood Way in May 1985. This old Macclesfield to Marple railway line derelict since its closure in 1970, was transformed by Macclesfield Borough Council using professional contractors, into a recreational way. The track is divided for use by horse-riders on one side & cyclists & walkers on the other.A path at the top of the embankments enables visitors to take advantage of the views to east & west.Cheshire Conservation Trust helped plan the regeneration of habitats weakened during the fallow years. The limestone bed was lost but 18,165 shrubs, 9558 trees & many flowers were planted to join the native flora in the area.The banking provides cover for warblers & other bird species.Small ponds and wet land are now the habitat of frogs, newts, insects & water plants.
